articles.title: Weekend Shootings In Texas And Wisconsin Add To Tally Of U.S. Gun Deaths - NPR
articles.description: After a big surge in gun deaths in 2020, high-profile mass shootings this spring are a reminder that America's epidemic of gun violence persists.
articles.content:
Emergency personnel work at the scene of a shooting Sunday in Austin. Police said three people were killed.
Jim Vertuno/AP

articles.title: Research Study: Leprosy Drug Holds Promise Against Covid - India West
articles.description: NEW YORK – A team of researchers, including one Indian American, has suggested that a leprosy drug holds promise as an at-home treatment for Covid-19.
articles.content:

articles.title: Half of US adults have received at least 1 dose of COVID-19 vaccine, CDC says - News 5 Cleveland
articles.description: As of Sunday morning, 50% of American adults 18 and older have received at least one dose of the coronavirus vaccine, according to vaccination data from the CDC.

articles.description: A Soyuz space capsule carrying NASA's Kate Rubins and Russians Sergey Ryzhikov and Sergey Kud-Sverchkov landed Saturday morning in the steppes of Kazakhstan.

articles.title: Citi's exit from consumer banking is 'no surprise' - The Star Online
articles.description: NEWS that American banking group Citigroup Inc is closing down its consumer banking business in 13 markets, including Malaysia, does not come as a surprise and has ignited fresh concerns that competition in the banking space can only get more heated.
